docs.lead_paragraph: Gov. Asa Hutchinson told an advisory group that he favored keeping the expansion, but only if the federal government allowed changes that seemed intended to appeal to conservative legislators.

headline.main: Arkansas Governor Wants to Keep Medicaid Expansion, but With Changes
headline.print_headline: Arkansas Governor Wants to Keep Medicaid Expansion, but With Changes

docs.abstract: Arkansas Gov Asa Hutchinson, in discussion with advisory group weighing future of state's alternative Medicaid expansion, comes out in favor of retaining plan with certain caveats; support is predicated on federal government allowing changes amenable to state's conservative legislators.
docs.snippet: Gov. Asa Hutchinson told an advisory group that he favored keeping the expansion, but only if the federal government allowed changes that seemed intended to appeal to conservative legislators.

docs.lead_paragraph: An effort to make the Chilean public health system more inclusive has taken an unusual turn, as non-indigenous patients increasingly look beyond Western medicine.

headline.main: Alongside a Doctor’s Care, a Dose of Traditional Healing
headline.print_headline: Alongside a Doctor’s Care, a Dose of Traditional Healing

docs.abstract: Santiago Journal; Mapuche healers in Santiago, Chile, say most of their patients are non-indigenous Chileans; Chilean government integrated indigenous health providers into some health clinics in order to provide for indigenous population.
docs.snippet: An effort to make the Chilean public health system more inclusive has taken an unusual turn, as non-indigenous patients increasingly look beyond Western medicine.

docs.lead_paragraph: In an exchange with an activist from Black Lives Matter, a candidate who has advocated civil rights for decades shows passion mixed with practicality.

headline.main: Hillary Clinton, Pressed on Race, Issues Her Own Challenge
headline.print_headline: Clinton and Black Activist, Raw and Unscripted

docs.abstract: Hillary Rodham Clinton is caught on camera being confronted by Black Lives Matter activist Julius Jones, turning tables on interaction during rare, unscripted moment in which Clinton offers forthright response; video shows Clinton discussing race relations and social justice in genuine and impassioned way, but also highlights gulf that remains between Clinton and younger generation of black activists, despite her years of service.
docs.snippet: In an exchange with an activist from Black Lives Matter, a candidate who has advocated civil rights for decades shows passion mixed with practicality.

docs.lead_paragraph: Shannen Doherty is battling breast cancer that worsened during a lapse in her health insurance caused by her former business managers, the actress claimed in a lawsuit filed Wednesday.

docs.lead_paragraph: In a story Aug. 18 about the reintroduction of right-to-die legislation in California, The Associated Press erroneously reported a comment by Debbie Ziegler, whose daughter moved from California to Oregon to legally take her own life. She said "What right does anyone of a specific religious faith have to demand I behave in concordance with their faith as I face my eminent death?"

docs.lead_paragraph: Community health care centers, a program that has a long bipartisan history, will receive some necessary funding.

headline.main: Help From the Obama Administration for Community Health Centers
headline.print_headline: A Part of Obamacare the G.O.P. Can Love

docs.abstract: Editorial welcomes Obama administration's decision to distribute an additional $169 million under the Affordable Care Act to open 266 new community health centers in 46 states; praises centers for providing primary care to some 23 million patients across country, for their preventive focus and for their history of strong bipartisan support.
docs.snippet: Community health care centers, a program that has a long bipartisan history, will receive some necessary funding.
